description: Castro-equivalent Experiment 2d baseline policy for Bank A. Starts with moderate collateral posting and liquidity-aware payment timing. Key difference from Exp 2c: no EOD penalty exists, so optimization targets minimizing (collateral cost + delay cost + overdraft cost) rather than maximizing settlement rate.

strategic_collateral_tree.description: At start of day, post a fraction of available collateral. This reduces overdraft usage but has opportunity cost (r_c).

on_true.description: Post initial_liquidity_fraction of max collateral capacity.

on_false.description: No collateral changes during the day.

payment_tree.description: Check if payment is approaching its deadline (urgent).

on_true.description: Payment is urgent - release to avoid delay costs escalating.

on_false.description: Check if we have enough liquidity (with buffer) to release without overdraft.

on_true.description: Have sufficient liquidity - release payment to avoid delay costs.

on_false.description: Insufficient liquidity - hold to avoid overdraft costs (r_b > r_d means overdraft is expensive).
